definition: to stretch oneself (on waking or when tired etc)

sentences.english: She woke slowly, sleepily, stretching in the sun.
sentences.chinese: 她慢慢地醒來了，睡眼朦朦地在太陽下伸伸懶腰。

sentences.english: He got up with a stretch and a yawn .
sentences.chinese: 他起了牀，伸個懶腰並打個呵欠。

sentences.english: Having finished their morning work the clerks stood up behind their desks stretching themselves.
sentences.chinese: 玩成了早間工作之後，職員們站到桌子後面伸伸懶腰。

sentences.english: This one lazy lumbar let Li Qiang from head to toe has become stronger and stronger.
sentences.chinese: 這一個懶腰讓李強從頭到腳都變得強大起來。
他打個哈欠，伸一伸懶腰。

sentences.english: Close your eyes for a few minutes. Breathe.
sentences.chinese: 伸個懶腰，活絡肩膀，閉上眼睛幾分鐘，呼吸。

sentences.english: Remember to stretch before you get up!
sentences.chinese: 起牀前別忘了伸個懶腰。

sentences.english: The cat woke up and stretched.
I stretched and rubbed my eyes.
sentences.chinese: 我伸了下懶腰，揉揉眼睛。

sentences.english: He stretched himself on his back and looked straight up at the blinking stars.
sentences.chinese: 他伸了個懶腰，仰望天上一眨一眨的星星。

sentences.english: I can't jump over the chain but what about taking a stretch.
sentences.chinese: 我走不出一條鎖鏈的範圍，但伸個懶腰總可以吧。

sentences.english: He sat up and stretched and yawned.
sentences.chinese: 他坐起身，伸伸懶腰，打了個哈欠。
我站了起來，伸了個懶腰。

sentences.english: Try this. Buy yourself a cow.
sentences.chinese: 你可以試試買一頭牛，然後把這頭牛懶腰截開。

sentences.english: When the wolf awoke and stretched out his legs, he felt very heavy and uncomfortable.
sentences.chinese: 當大野狼醒過來伸懶腰時，他覺得非常沉重而不舒服。

sentences.english: The cageling extended one to stretch.
